hero.title: Optima Pulse
hero.subtitle: Real-time business pulse, optimal decisions
hero.description: Query data, discuss decisions, and set actions through natural language
hero.card1Desc: Lightweight integration with enterprise data sources, no ETL needed
hero.card2Desc: Industry expert experience encoded as reusable Skills
hero.card3Desc: Natural language queries, analysis, recommendations, actions

architecture.title: Product Architecture
architecture.subtitle: Three-layer design, lightweight integration, deep understanding

items.title: CLI Tools Layer
items.label: Data Access
items.description: Each data source = one CLI tool. Standardized interfaces, plug and play. Adding a new data source requires no ETL pipeline — just write a CLI tool.

items.title: Skills Layer
items.label: Domain Knowledge
items.description: Encode industry experts' judgment into reusable Skills. Switch industries = switch Skills, the core engine stays the same.

items.title: Agent Layer
items.label: Orchestration & Reasoning
items.description: Understands user intent, invokes tools for data, selects Skills for analysis. Supports multi-turn dialogue, follow-up questions, and proactive suggestions.

useCases.title: AI Decision Scenarios Validated by Enterprises
useCases.subtitle: These scenarios are proven at leading Chinese enterprises with quantifiable ROI — Optima Pulse brings the same capabilities to growing businesses

items.title: Inventory & Supply Chain Decisions
items.description: Connect inventory, sales, and logistics data to get real-time restocking advice, stockout alerts, and supply chain optimization. From reactive to data-driven proactive decisions.

cases.result: R&D cycle shortened from 100 to 27 days (-73%), only 40% initial orders, rest placed based on rolling data
Delivery efficiency +50%, labor costs -30%, AI-powered supply chain decision support across network
41 Agents across supply chain, delivery cycle -55%, operating costs -32%
Dynamic fulfillment routing per order, logistics costs -10%, receiving efficiency +30%

items.title: Natural Language Data Query & Decisions
items.description: Query enterprise data in natural language, with automatic root cause analysis and report generation. Reduce data insights from days to seconds.

cases.result: BI 'Ask Data' assistant covers 9 business domains across R&D, production, supply, and sales
Business insights reduced from 2-3 days (request→data team→execute→return) to instant conversation
184 AI scenarios, ¥390M economic value in 6 months, saving 4.75M work hours
Executive monthly reports from 20 hours to 0.5 hours, decision response speed +80%

items.title: Marketing & Operations Optimization
items.description: Feed marketing data, user behavior, and operational metrics into the Agent for automatic analysis, strategy optimization, and content generation. From intuition-driven to data-driven operations.

cases.result: AI store manager serves 40K frontline staff, marketing CTR +40%, conversion +25%, operational efficiency +39%
AI ordering 99% accuracy, 100K+ daily triggers, full coverage from ordering to R&D to store replenishment
Livestream patrol Agent: dwell time +12%, violations -50%; customer service ticket efficiency +80%
180+ AI scenarios, content production cycle -60%+, labor costs -90%

items.title: Enterprise Intelligence Hub
items.description: Deploy cross-department Agent networks, encoding industry knowledge into reusable decision models. From point tools to an enterprise-wide intelligence hub.

cases.result: 5,000+ Agents deployed, saving 3.96M hours, cost savings target raised from ¥20M to ¥100M
Decision model efficiency +120x, covering 20+ scenarios including demand forecasting and route optimization
200+ scenarios, 2.2B AI service calls, annual cost savings of ¥10B
35,000+ industrial mechanism models, OEE +7.2%, saving $5.3M annually

conversation.title: Use data like talking to an expert
conversation.subtitle: Not just returning data — understanding business context, giving advice, asking follow-ups, setting actions

messages.content: Which SKU had the highest return rate last week?

Sneakers SKU-2031, return rate 12.3%, main reason: sizing runs small (68% of returns).
Suggestion: Add a "runs half size small" note on the product page. SKU-1892 made a similar change and return rate dropped 40%.
Talked to the supplier, they'll adjust the last next batch. How long will my current stock last?

At 43 pairs daily average over the past 7 days, current stock of 312 pairs will last 7.3 days.
However, if returns drop to normal levels (~5%), net sales will increase and you'd run out in about 6 days.
Want me to draft a restock order?
Not yet, let's wait for the new batch. Keep an eye on it — alert me when stock drops below 100 pairs.
Done. Inventory alert set: you'll be notified when SKU-2031 drops below 100 pairs.

items.label: No data engineers needed for modeling and maintenance
Connected to real enterprise data, not copy-paste
Built-in industry Skills, no prompt engineering needed
Can set alerts and follow-up actions
Lightweight integration (CLI tools, not ETL pipelines)
